author: Special Correspondent
text:
A State-level painting competition organised by Central Ground Water Board (CGWB) will be held here on Thursday.

Painting competitions for schoolchildren are being organised nationwide by CGWB since 2010 to familiarise children about the value of water resources, its augmentation, conservation, recycling and reuse.

The competition is organised at three levels - school level, State level and national level.

The target group are those studying from Standard VI to VIII.

The school-level competition (sixth in series) was held all over the country from October – December 2015 on themes such as contamination of groundwater with Arsenic and other contamination issues, Nirmal Nadi and stop river pollution.

A release from the CGWB said the school-level painting competition was conducted in Union Territory in co-ordination with Directorate of School Education.

In all, 9,187 students from 126 school participated.

The school authorities selected best three paintings from each school and sent them to the State Training Centre, Directorate of School Education, Puducherry.

A board of jury selected the 50 best paintings and the students concerned have been invited to take part in the State-level painting competition to be held on Thursday at Seagull, Lake View Restaurant, Ossudu Lake.
title: State-level painting competition today
